Class Pet

java.lang.Object
classes.Pet
public class Pet extends Object
The Pet class defines a virtual pet's core data and behavior. It contains its statistics, current state, and available commands. The pet transitions between different mood states and is affected by hunger, sleep, health, and happiness values.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Darsh Srikanth

      Constructs a pet with default stats (all set to 100).

      petName - the name of the pet
      petType - the animal type of the pet

    • Pet

      public Pet(String petName, Animal petType, int[] stats)
      Constructs a pet with custom stats.
      Parameters:
      petName - the name of the pet
      petType - the animal type of the pet
      stats - the array of stats: health, hunger, sleep, happiness

    • printCommands

      public void printCommands()
      Prints the status of all available commands for the pet. Each command from 0 to 5 is checked, and a message is printed indicating whether it is currently enabled or disabled. Useful for debugging and verifying state-based command availability. Command indexes: 0 - Feed 1 - Gift 2 - Bed 3 - Vet 4 - Play 5 - Exercise
